translation: O Arjuna, wisdom is enveloped by this constant enemy of the wise, in the form of desire, which is insatiable like fire.
commentary: 3.39 enveloped enveloped? Knowledge wisdom? Eten by this? wise of the wise? nityavairina by the constant enemy? Kamarupana whose form is desire? Kaunteya Or Kaunteya? unappeasable by bad filling? Unleashed by fire? f and.Commentary Manu says? Desire can never be satiated or cooled down by the enjoyment ofobjects. But as fire blazes forth the more when fed with Ghee (melted butter) and wood? so it grows the more
